content:
It's understandable to be hesitant about confronting someone in public since it could potentially lead to an unpleasant situation. Therefore, it's always better to prioritize your safety, and you can consider the behavior and manner of the person before taking any action. 

If you're uncomfortable about speaking up, you could try moving away, creating a physical barrier or seeking help from an authority figure. Remember that you have the right to be comfortable and safe in your personal space.

If you do decide to speak up, try to do so politely and calmly, and be prepared to back off if the person responds negatively. Your safety should be your top priority, and if the person becomes abusive or threatening, seek help immediately. If you don't feel comfortable confronting someone directly, you could try reporting the situation to authorities or personnel, and they can help intervene in the situation.
